S100.shortDescription: Methods and properties should be named in PascalCase
S100.fullDescription: Shared naming conventions allow teams to collaborate efficiently. This rule checks whether or not method and property names are PascalCased. To reduce noise, two consecutive upper case characters are allowed unless they form the whole name. So, MyXMethod is compliant, but XM on its own is not.

S109.shortDescription: Magic numbers should not be used
S109.fullDescription: A magic number is a number that comes out of nowhere, and is directly used in a statement. Magic numbers are often used, for instance to limit the number of iterations of a loop, to test the value of a property, etc.

S1118.shortDescription: Utility classes should not have public constructors
S1118.fullDescription: Utility classes, which are collections of static members, are not meant to be instantiated.

S1125.shortDescription: Boolean literals should not be redundant
S1125.fullDescription: Redundant Boolean literals should be removed from expressions to improve readability.

S1128.fullDescription: Although unnecessary using won't change anything to the produced application, removing them:

S1192.shortDescription: String literals should not be duplicated
S1192.fullDescription: Duplicated string literals make the process of refactoring error-prone, since you must be sure to update all occurrences.

S125.shortDescription: Sections of code should not be commented out
S125.fullDescription: Programmers should not comment out code as it bloats programs and reduces readability.

S1451.shortDescription: Track lack of copyright and license headers
S1451.fullDescription: Each source file should start with a header stating file ownership and the license which must be used to distribute the application.

S1481.shortDescription: Unused local variables should be removed
S1481.fullDescription: If a local variable is declared but not used, it is dead code and should be removed. Doing so will improve maintainability because developers will not wonder what the variable is used for.

S2148.shortDescription: Underscores should be used to make large numbers readable
S2148.fullDescription: Beginning with C# 7, it is possible to add underscores ('_') to numeric literals to enhance readability. The addition of underscores in this manner has no semantic meaning, but makes it easier for maintainers to understand the code.

S2221.shortDescription: "Exception" should not be caught when not required by called methods
S2221.fullDescription: Catching System.Exception seems like an efficient way to handle multiple possible exceptions. Unfortunately, it traps all exception types, including the ones that were not intended to be caught. To prevent any misunderstandings, the exception filters should be used. Alternatively each exception type should be in a separate catch block.

S2325.shortDescription: Methods and properties that don't access instance data should be static
S2325.fullDescription: Methods and properties that don't access instance data can be static to prevent any misunderstanding about the contract of the method.

S3242.shortDescription: Method parameters should be declared with base types
S3242.fullDescription: When a derived type is used as a parameter instead of the base type, it limits the uses of the method. If the additional functionality that is provided in the derived type is not requires then that limitation isn't required, and should be removed.

S3257.shortDescription: Declarations and initializations should be as concise as possible
S3257.fullDescription: Unnecessarily verbose declarations and initializations make it harder to read the code, and should be simplified.

S3353.fullDescription: Marking a variable that is unchanged after initialization const is an indication to future maintainers that "no this isn't updated, and it's not supposed to be". const should be used in these situations in the interests of code clarity.

S3923.shortDescription: All branches in a conditional structure should not have exactly the same implementation
S3923.fullDescription: Having all branches in a switch or if chain with the same implementation is an error. Either a copy-paste error was made and something different should be executed, or there shouldn't be a switch/if chain at all.

S3990.shortDescription: Assemblies should be marked as CLS compliant
S3990.fullDescription: Assemblies should conform with the Common Language Specification (CLS) in order to be usable across programming languages. To be compliant an assembly has to indicate it with System.CLSCompliantAttribute.

S3992.shortDescription: Assemblies should explicitly specify COM visibility
S3992.fullDescription: Assemblies should explicitly indicate whether they are meant to be COM visible or not. If the ComVisibleAttribute is not present, the default is to make the content of the assembly visible to COM clients.

S4056.shortDescription: Overloads with a "CultureInfo" or an "IFormatProvider" parameter should be used
S4056.fullDescription: When a System.Globalization.CultureInfo or IFormatProvider object is not supplied, the default value that is supplied by the overloaded member might not have the effect that you want in all locales.

S4261.shortDescription: Methods should be named according to their synchronicities
S4261.fullDescription: According to the Task-based Asynchronous Pattern (TAP), methods returning either a System.Threading.Tasks.Task or a System.Threading.Tasks.Task<TResult> are considered "asynchronous". Such methods should use the Async suffix. Conversely methods which do not return such Tasks should not have an "Async" suffix in their names.

S4823.shortDescription: Using command line arguments is security-sensitive
S4823.fullDescription: Using command line arguments is security-sensitive. It has led in the past to the following vulnerabilities:

S4834.fullDescription: The access control of an application must be properly implemented in order to restrict access to resources to authorized entities otherwise this could lead to vulnerabilities:

S5332.fullDescription: Clear-text protocols as ftp, telnet or non secure http are lacking encryption of transported data. They are also missing the capability to build an authenticated connection. This mean that any attacker who can sniff traffic from the network can read, modify or corrupt the transported content. These protocol are not secure as they expose applications to a large range of risk:

S927.shortDescription: Parameter names should match base declaration and other partial definitions
S927.fullDescription: The name of a parameter in an externally visible. This rule raises an issue when method override does not match the name of the parameter in the base declaration of the method, or the name of the parameter in the interface declaration of the method or the name of any other partial definition.
